articles.title: Japan Needs Immigration To Thrive, Says Top CEO
articles.description: The Indian-born CEO of a leading snack brand says recruiting more foreign workers is "very critical" to the future of Japan's economy.
articles.content:
What's New
Japan needs to bring in more immigrants if it hopes to reclaim its lost economic prominence, a foreign-born CEO says.
Newsweek reached out to the Japanese Foreign Ministry by email with a request for comment.

articles.title: Here is why Rahul Dravid slept in the Economy class during India’s triumphant return
articles.description: Rahul Dravid's unexpected slumber in economy class and Rohit Sharma’s playful banter added spice to India's victorious flight home. Hurricane delay couldn't dampen India's World Cup winning spirit as the team and Indian media embarked on a historic homecoming journey.
articles.content: India‘s thrilling T20 World Cup victory in Barbados on June 29th marked the end of a long, arduous wait for an ICC title. The win was especially sweet as it coincided with the retirement of cricketing legends Virat Kohli and Rohit Sharma from the T20... [4026 chars]

articles.title: Can Indian farmers find a way to prosper in erratic monsoons?
articles.description: India’s monsoon season is arguably the single most important weather phenomenon for the country, and a good monsoon can boost the nation’s economy and the livelihoods of 120 million farmers.
articles.content:
BENGALURU, India (AP) — Each year from June to September, a heavy band of rain makes its way from India’s southwest coast to its northeastern borders, quenching farmers’ thirsty fields.
India’s monsoon season is arguably the single most important wea... [6758 chars]

articles.title: It’s the economy, stupid. Modi’s India reelection is good news
articles.description: India's election is a victory for Modi's economic growth agenda. The Indian people and American investors should benefit.
articles.content: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi claimed a third term in office on Tuesday. Still, voters delivered a cautionary message as Modi’s margin of victory was much narrower than expected. Modi and his Bharatiya Janata Party colleagues will now refocus o... [3222 chars]

articles.title: Indian economy expanded by 8.4% in final three months of 2023
articles.description: A boom in manufacturing helped India's economy surge in the fourth quarter with annual GDP up 8.4% compared with the same period in 2022, as the world's fastest-growing economy eyes its nearest rivals, Japan and Germany.
articles.content:
A boom in manufacturing helped India's economy surge in the October to December quarter of 2023 with annual GDP up 8.4% compared with the same period in 2022, official government figures show. File photo by Jeff Kowalsky/UPI

articles.title: Indian economy regains its swagger as China stumbles
articles.description: China has long been the engine of global growth, but its real estate crisis and slowing economy has alarmed international investors. India is fast emerging as a potential successor.
articles.content:
New Delhi CNN —
India’s economy is like an elephant. The world’s most populous nation is hard to get moving, but a force to reckon with once in action, analysts often say.
